LanguageData.JobInBar_ShowJobLabelFor: Show job title in colonist bar
LanguageData.JobInBar_PlaySettingsToggle: Show/hide job labels in the colonist bar. Disabling this can slightly improve performance in large colonies.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_ModEnabled_Desc: Use this to disable the mod entirely if things are behaving strangely.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_PerformanceWarning:
Note on Performance:
For large colonies, it is recommended to tweak these settings so that fewer labels are drawn overall. Unity's text rendering code is not the most optimized, so if there are a ton of labels being drawn all the time you might notice a slight performance dip (the more labels the worse it will be).
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawLabelOnlyOnHover: Only show labels on mouse hover
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawLabelOnlyOnHover_D:
Only draws labels for pawns the mouse is currently hovering over in the colonist bar.
Recommended if you're having performance problems or if you have a colony with a large number of pawns.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_CurrentJobNote: Note that the current task is only shown when the mouse is hovered, for performance reasons. Fetching the current task of a pawn is a relatively expensive operation and it would quickly tank performance to do it multiple times a frame for multiple pawns.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawCurrentTask_Desc: If enabled, a label will be drawn for the task that a pawn is currently performing (ie cleaning/crafting/building).
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_MoveWeaponBelowCurrent: Move weapon icon below current task

When the curren task label is shown, shift the equipped weapon icon down to move it out of the way. Otherwise, shift the label down below the weapon. Enabling this may cause annoying flickering as the weapon shifts when you hover over a pawn.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawJobTitle_Desc:
Draws a colonist's current job title. The main function of the mod.
Set a custom job title in the pawn's Rename dialog (from the Bio tab). Otherwise defaults to a shortened version of their backstory.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_JobTitleNote: Note that you can set this individually for a pawn in their Rename dialog.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_EnablePlaySettingToggl: Play setting toggle to disable/enable all labels
Adds a new toggle to the global play settings (the little buttons in the bottom right) to toggle ALL labels from this mod on/off at once. Overrides global settings and individual pawn settings.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_JobLabelVerticalOffset: An absolute amount of pixels that all labels will be offset by. Change this if you want more distinction from the vanilla name label.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_WeaponOffset_Desc: When the (vanilla) option "Weapons below portrait" is enabled, the labels will be offset to make room for it. Use this slider to adjust how much. Pawns with lots of labels and an equipped weapon would get visually cluttered if this is set too high.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawBackground_Desc: Draw a black box behind the job title, just like the name label.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_Truncate_Desc: If turned off, long job titles will overflow. Looks ugly but might be the behavior you want.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_EquippedSubLabel: If the vanilla "Weapons below portrait" preference is enabled, the mod will alter how things are drawn so it doesn't overlap with labels. Use these settings to adjust to your liking (or disable it altogether).
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_OffsetEquippedExtra_De: Number of pixels to vertically offset the equipped weapon icon by, regardless of labels.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_OffsetEquippedByLabels: Move equipped weapon icon under labels
If enabled, the icon for the currently equipped weapon will be offset vertically so that it appears underneath the labels, instead of overlapping them.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_TruncateLongLabels_Des: Labels will be shortened so they don't overlap each other if they're too long to fit within the width of one colonist in the bar. This technically incurs a tiny performance cost every frame, but it should be negligible.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawIdeoRoles_Desc: If Ideology is installed, draws the specialist roles in the color of their ideology below the job label.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_UseIdeoColorForRole_De: Automatically detect the color of an ideological role based on the color of the ideology itself. Otherwise, a specific color.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_IdeoRoleColorOverride_: If the "Use Ideology color for roles" setting is disabled, this color will be used for all ideological roles instead.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_RoleColorAbility: Only use role color if ability cooldown is ready
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_RoleColorAbility_Desc: If enabled, the ideology role color will only be used if the role's ability cooldown is complete and the ability can be used. Otherwise will be the same color as the name label.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawRoyalTitles: Add a label for any Royalty titles
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DrawRoyalTitles_Desc:
If the pawn has any Royal titles, adds the name of their title below the label.
Can be disabled on an individual basis in the pawn's Rename dialog.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_RoyalTitleColor_Desc: Defaults to the vanilla Imperial color.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_RoyalTitleNote: Note that (currently) only the "first" royal title that a pawn has will be considered. If you have mods that add other factions that grant titles, it will not show every single title that a pawn owns if they have more than one.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_DefaultShow_Desc: Sets the default for if job labels should be shown. Can be toggled individually per-colonist.
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_OnlyDrawCustomJobTitle: A pawn's starting backstory will not be used as their label. Job titles are only shown if you set a custom job title for the pawn (using the rename dialog).
LanguageData.JobInBar_Settings_Cache_Tip: This is only for debugging. Use this page to manually check or delete entries from the cache if something is going wrong.
